Class Display

java.lang.Object
Display
public class Display
extends java.lang.Object

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Controller controller
    Field used to store the controller that is connected to the display
    private javax.swing.JTextField coolingIcon
    Textfield that displays the cooling status
    private javax.swing.JPanel function1  
    private javax.swing.JPanel function2  
    private javax.swing.JTextField[] inputs
    Index 0 and 1 and temperatureSetpoint and deadband fields respectively indices 2 to 9 are temperature inputs (function 2 temperature inputs) index 10 is used for temperature input 0 (function 1 temperature input)
    private javax.swing.JLabel[] outputLabels
    A size 3 array to store the labels of the 3 output textfields
    private javax.swing.JTextField[] outputs
    A size 3 array used to display the output values
    private javax.swing.JFrame window
    Field used to access the window component of the GUI Window size is initially set to width = 460 and height = 600

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Display​(Controller cont)
    Constructor function for the Display class, sets the window size to width = 460, height = 600 with no layout manager.

    This function is used to set the controller variable to a specified controller object in order to access the control logic functions and data

    This function is called by the Update() function of a Controller object to set the label and value of a output textfield to a desired value.

    This function is used by a controller object to set a specified input to a value.
    void initInputs​(int index)
    This function sets up a specified textfield to listen for an "enter" key press.
    void setCoolingIcon​(boolean input)
    This function sets the icon of the cooling display to on or off based on the input.

    • controller

      private Controller controller

    • window

      Field used to access the window component of the GUI Window size is initially set to width = 460 and height = 600

    • inputs

      private javax.swing.JTextField[] inputs
      Index 0 and 1 and temperatureSetpoint and deadband fields respectively indices 2 to 9 are temperature inputs (function 2 temperature inputs) index 10 is used for temperature input 0 (function 1 temperature input)

    • outputs

      private javax.swing.JTextField[] outputs
      A size 3 array used to display the output values

  • Constructor Details

    • Display

      public Display​(Controller cont)
      Constructor function for the Display class, sets the window size to width = 460, height = 600 with no layout manager. Initialises the sizes of all textfields and labels to width = 150 and height = 20. Uses the setBounds function to set all the locations of the textfields and labels. Sets the window closing event to terminate the program.
      Parameters:
      cont - is copied into this.controller in order to access control logic methods and data.

  • Method Details

    • initInputs

      public void initInputs​(int index)
      This function sets up a specified textfield to listen for an "enter" key press. If the key press event is detected, the Update() function from the Controller class will be called.
      Parameters:
      index - specifies the textfield to setup. this function should be ran 11 times by the main function to set up every single textfield.

    • connect

      public void connect​(Controller cont)
      This function is used to set the controller variable to a specified controller object in order to access the control logic functions and data

    • displayTemperatureInputs

      public void displayTemperatureInputs​(int index, double value)
      This function is used by a controller object to set a specified input to a value.
      Parameters:
      index - is used to specify the index of the inputs[] array that needs to be changed.
      value - is the new value that should be displayed.

    • displayOutputs

      public void displayOutputs​(double value, int index, int dispIndex)
      This function is called by the Update() function of a Controller object to set the label and value of a output textfield to a desired value.
      Parameters:
      index - is an integer value that dictates which outputs and outputLabels element will be changed
      value - is a double value which contains the new value to be displayed

    • setCoolingIcon

      public void setCoolingIcon​(boolean input)
      This function sets the icon of the cooling display to on or off based on the input.
      Parameters:
      input - is a boolean value, if input = true, cooling is set to ON else cooling is set to OFF
